private_information: I am allowed to move only disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only the top disk of any peg; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Cooperatively achieve the target configuration while only moving disks A through H when required.

private_information: I am allowed to move only disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only the top disk of any peg; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Cooperatively achieve the target configuration while only moving disks I through O when required.

private_information: I coordinate plans from agent_1 and agent_2 and ensure they are consistent with the audited constraints before producing the final artifacts.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move proposals, apply audited constraints, produce the ordered primitive move list, and emit a final PDDL domain and problem for the Fast Downward solver.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts, quota tokens, and post-hoc penalties; I accept only moves that are feasible from the prior state, respect the Tower of Hanoi rules, and respect each agent's disk permissions.
auditor.goal: Validate and, if necessary, minimally correct the proposed moves so that they are temporally consistent, causally valid, and compliant with agent restrictions and Hanoi rules.

rules: Move only one disk at a time.
Only the top disk of a peg may be moved.
No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1 may move only disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
agent_2 may move only disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.

public_information: This is a 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance with 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agent capabilities: agent_1 may move disks A-H; agent_2 may move disks I-O.
Initial configuration: left peg has A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O (top to bottom); middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O (top to bottom); middle peg has B; right peg has A, C (top to bottom).
Objective: Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that achieves the goal while respecting the rules and agent restrictions.

primitive_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
notes: This sequence is minimal for isolating disks A, B, and C without disturbing disks D through O, which remain on the left peg in order.
All moves respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permissions; only agent_1 is required to act.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and may move only disks A-H. Propose a valid sequence of primitive moves that respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and the agent permission constraints, aiming to achieve the goal configuration or the parts that involve your disks; do not produce PDDL.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Produce a concise ordered list of moves formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that helps achieve {agents->orchestrator->goal}. If a minimal valid plan exists that requires only your moves, output only those moves; do not include commentary.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and may move only disks I-O. Propose a valid sequence of primitive moves that respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and the agent permission constraints, aiming to achieve the goal configuration or confirming that no moves by you are required; do not produce PDDL.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->agent_2->private_information}. If your moves are not required to achieve the goal, output an empty list; otherwise output an ordered list of moves formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' with no commentary.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor. Validate temporal and causal consistency, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and enforce the Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permission constraints; ensure every move is feasible from the immediately preceding state and no disk teleports or violates ordering.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Given proposed moves from agent_1 and agent_2, verify compliance with {environment->init->rules}. If necessary, minimally correct, reorder, or prune moves to achieve the goal {environment->init->goal_configuration_top_to_bottom} from the initial state {environment->init->initial_configuration_top_to_bottom}. Produce a short report of any corrections and confirm the final validated sequence.

compile_plan.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate agents' proposals using the auditor's findings into a single ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the goal without violating any rules.
compile_plan.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Merge validated moves into one sequence formatted strictly as 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' with one move per line and no commentary; the sequence must achieve {environment->init->goal_configuration_top_to_bottom} from {environment->init->initial_configuration_top_to_bottom} respecting {environment->init->rules}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL for Fast Downward. Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem encoding for this 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance, ensuring compatibility with the Fast Downward solver; enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
pddl.prompt: Generate a multi-agent PDDL domain and a problem instance for the Fast Downward solver capturing the pegs, disks A-O with size ordering, legal moves, agent-specific move permissions (agent_1 for A-H and agent_2 for I-O), the initial state {environment->init->initial_configuration_top_to_bottom}, and the goal state {environment->init->goal_configuration_top_to_bottom}. Include types, predicates, action schemas parameterized by agent and disk with preconditions enforcing top-of-peg and size constraints, and ensure grounded objects reflect all pegs and disks. Enclose outputs with <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
